text: The original being my favorite 2D Zelda, I was cautiously excited for this remake. It looked great, but I couldn't shake the feeling the original's atmosphere might get lost starting with the music. The Face Shrine is the perfect theme to check if the unique ambience is retained and I can only be happy with the result. Nagamatsu obviously had respect for this particular theme with his awesome decision to keep the original's motif Gameboy-style. I'm now officially hyped to go through this adventure once again.
author: SupraDarky

text: I just can't get over the look of the game. Most likely will just stick with the original. The starting cutscene showing Link out at sea got me super hyped, til they showed the game. Not for everyone!
author: Everlasting

text: It's just a square lead, I'd prefer something better-sounding than what's in there. I mean a nicer square lead.  Keeping a similarly-timed delay effect would suffice to keep the "ambience", apart from the same arp sequence, which is present.
author: Licinius Varrus

text:
It was my first Zelda game, ever.
I was pretty young when I played the game, and I never really felt like the game was meant to be that chibi back then.

The new look is just a tad too much cuteness and chibi for my taste
author: DerUnbekannteFlo

text: I agree, I found this theme yesterday, most of the other castle themes are just updated versions of the original. This one however increases the depth of feeling found after you learn the truth. The only complaint I have is that the new music should have lowered in volume when the chiptune sections began, the original sounds get lost in the new sounds.

text: I ran into this theme yesterday and I was immediately impressed (never played the original). I also love soundtracks in general and your channel is the perfect place to keep the love alive. Keep up the great work!

author: Matthew Falls

text: I am so, SO happy that the Face Shrine music sounds as good as I had hoped. It was my favorite song from the original, being very emotionally heavy (given the context) even for an 8 bit song. I get chills every time I hear the original chiptune kick in.
author: Frediculous

text: This was always my favorite song in the original, so I was excited to hear it in the remake. When I first heard I was a little taken aback how different it was to the original but it almost immediately became my favorite song in the remake, plus the little 8 bit throwback was a nice touch.
author: Dakota Clayton

text: This is simply fantastic.
author: Stephen Marseille

text:
After finding out the truth about Koholint Island, you don't want to leave but it must be done.

The Wind Fish must awaken, even if it hurts to do so.
author: Exalted

text: Best piece üëåüëå
author: Links Crazy Life

text:
The Face Shrines are the turning point in the game. Not many other game cameos or whimsical moments after this (unless you haven't got the frog song yet, I guess) and every interaction with major characters is touched by sadness. This song hits like a truck. And it's one of the few that uses the original 8 bit sound. 

Also there's this weird feeling that comes with smashing those big statues, like you're shattering the illusion.
author: Jason Carrington

text: It's like you're walking through a dark, quiet city after hearing about creepy happenings happening, and you find out the truth that you can't do anything about it because you have nothing you CAN do about it. As you leave town, you notice the creepy happenings, well, happening around you, and all you can do is keep walking.
author: Kyle Satwon

text: Sad.
author: amaillo

text: I remember playing through this and hearing this theme and having a slight existential crisis lol
author: Logan Sweets

text: Who wouldn't after just learning your course of action will literally result in the end of the world as you know it... It's a real tragedy :(
author: Craig Ineson

text:
This song feels like so many things. A tragedy. A terrible truth. Pain in a hero's heart, but unshakeable resolve pushes him onward. The Wind Fish must awaken. He must awaken. It is the nature of dreams to end...

No matter how lovely they are.

author: Agarillo Bob

text: @Agarillo Bob What do you mean main line? Link's Awakening is main series. Handheld games are just usually cheaper than home console games. But this remake is a home console game. Also, most people haven't beat the game even more than once, so it would be at least 20 hours for them. I would estimate at least 40 hours for people who haven't played the game before.
author: some pizza guy

text: @some pizza guy this, this guy gets it. just because you beat the game a million times doesn't mean it's a 6 hour game, if you actualy play games to enjoy them and don't speedrun them, games like this one are fully justified with thier pricing.
author: The Human Stunlock

text:
@some pizza guy main line as in full 3D and not top down handheld, I know Z1-2 and Alttp where all top down but that was years ago


eh I dunno going into this blind 20 hours is already a pretty long time but I see that most people are not good at video games, does not matter tho its a remake of a handheld and def one of the shortest zelda titles and therefore overpriced
author: Agarillo Bob

text:
@Agarillo Bob The top down Zelda games are "main line", too, like A Link Between Worlds and Minish Cap. Perspective shouldn't change a price. Link's Awakening really isn't that short, and I don't think there is even one short canon Zelda game. Saying it's the shortest compared to other Zelda titles doesn't mean much.. Also, there seem to be some added collectibles in the remake that would add to the length of the original. 
Handheld games are really only inferior to home console games graphically (though the Game Boy has the limitation of not having many buttons). Whether this remake is overpriced or not depends on the consumer. Some people may think the game is long enough while other might not, and some might finish the game faster than others. Some people only want to beat the story and don't want to get any collectibles or do any side quest. So I think it is not overpriced, at least for some people.
author: some pizza guy

text:
@some pizza guy oh yea ALBW and minish cap are both not main line games, they are sure first party zelda games but not main developmenet studio / main line, just as this. Inferiority is as well not the point here. 
I¬¥m not talking about some opinion if one finds it overprized and one might not I¬¥m talking about the facts here. Remake. Short. Not Mainline. The original was one of the cheapest. this IS overpriced yes and there is literally no reason to argue, Price to content ratio here is lackluster compared to other zelda games. The price is that high because Nintendo knows people will buy it and tbf its half a day of work payment so nothing I could not buy or I just wait 2-3 years till the game has a reasonable price of 30-20 money I would have even understood a launch price of 40 but paying the same then other first party nintendo games is just unacceptable
